benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Block an account

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) cover successful blocking with minimal and full data.
Invalid Payload: Scenarios TC09, TC10, TC14 cover missing or malformed request bodies and malicious payloads.
Duplicate Submission: TC23 addresses regression for duplicate BlockingState entries.
Large Payloads: TC20 tests handling of large BlockingState arrays.
Validation: TC07, TC13 validate accountId format and injection attempts; TC15 tests empty pluginProperty array; TC16 and TC17 test max/min field lengths.
Server Error Handling: TC12 simulates database unavailability; TC22 simulates plugin service unavailability.
Query Parameters: TC02, TC03, TC04, TC15, TC18 test various query parameter combinations including optional and extra parameters.
Headers: TC08 tests missing required header; TC02 tests optional headers.
Performance: TC25 and TC26 cover concurrency and resource utilization under load.
Security: TC13 and TC14 cover injection and malicious payloads.
Integration: TC21 and TC22 test plugin interactions.
Regression and backward compatibility: TC23 and TC24.
Error Scenarios: TC06 (account not found), TC07 (invalid accountId), TC08 (missing header), TC09/10 (malformed body), TC11 (unauthorized), TC12 (service unavailable).
Response Validation: All success scenarios validate status code 201 and response body content.
gaps: Duplicate Submission: Only one regression test (TC23) covers duplicates; no explicit test for idempotency or repeated identical requests.
Rate Limiting: No tests cover rate limiting or throttling behavior.
Server Error Handling: No explicit test for generic 500 Internal Server Error beyond database unavailability.
Soft Deletes: No tests verify behavior if the account is soft deleted or blocked previously and then deleted.
Concurrency Issues: No explicit tests for race conditions or concurrent updates to the same account blocking state.
Caching Behavior: No tests cover caching headers or behavior.
Accessibility: Only one scenario (TC27) addresses documentation and error message accessibility, but no tests for API response accessibility features.
recommendations: Add explicit tests for duplicate submission handling and idempotency to ensure repeated requests do not cause inconsistent states.
Include rate limiting and throttling tests to verify system behavior under rapid repeated requests.
Add tests simulating generic server errors (500) beyond database unavailability to cover broader error handling.
Test behavior when accounts are soft deleted or previously blocked and then deleted to ensure correct error or success responses.
Add concurrency tests to simulate race conditions when multiple requests update the same account blocking state simultaneously.
Include tests for caching headers and behavior to improve performance and client-side caching.
Expand accessibility tests to cover API response formats and error messages for screen reader compatibility and other accessibility standards.
